Package infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov

Class TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.continuous.TransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo
      • infodynamics.measures.continuous.TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateViaCondMutualInfo
        • infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov.TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelCalculator, ChannelCalculatorCommon, ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate, InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous, TransferEntropyCalculator, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariate, EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer
    public class TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov
extends TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateViaCondMutualInfo

    Computes the differential transfer entropy (TE) between two multivariate double[][] time-series of observations (implementing TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariate), using Kraskov-Stoegbauer-Grassberger (KSG) estimation (see references below). This estimator is realised here by plugging in a ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov as the calculator into the parent class TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateViaCondMutualInfo.

    Crucially, the calculation is performed by examining neighbours in the full joint space (as specified by Frenzel and Pompe, and Gomez-Herrero et al.) rather than two MI calculators.

    Usage is as per the paradigm outlined for TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariate, with:

    • The constructor step is either a simple call to TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov(), or else specifies which KSG algorithm to implement via TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov(String);
    • setProperty(String, String) allowing properties defined for both TransferEntropyCalculator.setProperty(String, String) and ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov.setProperty(String, String) as outlined in TransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo.setProperty(String, String)); as well as for PROP_KRASKOV_ALG_NUM.
    • Computed values are in nats, not bits!

    References:

    • T. Schreiber, "Measuring information transfer", Physical Review Letters 85 (2) pp.461-464, 2000.
    • J.T. Lizier, J. Heinzle, A. Horstmann, J.-D. Haynes, M. Prokopenko, "Multivariate information-theoretic measures reveal directed information structure and task relevant changes in fMRI connectivity", Journal of Computational Neuroscience, vol. 30, pp. 85-107, 2011.
    • Frenzel and Pompe, "Partial Mutual Information for Coupling Analysis of Multivariate Time Series", Physical Review Letters, 99, p. 204101+ (2007).
    • G. Gomez-Herrero, W. Wu, K. Rutanen, M. C. Soriano, G. Pipa, and R. Vicente, "Assessing coupling dynamics from an ensemble of time series", arXiv:1008.0539 (2010).
    • Kraskov, A., Stoegbauer, H., Grassberger, P., "Estimating mutual information", Physical Review E 69, (2004) 066138.
    • J. T. Lizier, M. Prokopenko and A. Zomaya, "Local information transfer as a spatiotemporal filter for complex systems" Physical Review E 77, 026110, 2008.
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)
    See Also:
    TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateViaCondMutualInfo, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariate

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov()
      Creates a new instance of the Kraskov-estimate style multivariate transfer entropy calculator Uses algorithm 1 by default, as per Gomez-Herro et al.
      TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov​(int algorithm)
      Creates a new instance of the Kraskov-Grassberger style transfer entropy calculator, with the CMI Kraskov calculator using the given Kraskov algorithm number

      Creates a new instance of the Kraskov-Grassberger style transfer entropy calculator, with the supplied conditional MI calculator name

                       int k_tau,
                       int l,
                       int l_tau,
                       int delay)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateViaCondMutualInfo
        Initialise the calculator for re-use with new observations. New embedding parameters, source and dest dimensions and source-destination delay may be supplied here; all other parameters remain unchanged.
        Overrides:
        initialise in class TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateViaCondMutualInfo
        Parameters:
        sourceDimensions - dimensionality of the source variable
        destDimensions - dimensionality of the destination variable
        k - Length of destination past history to consider
        k_tau - embedding delay for the destination variable
        l - length of source past history to consider
        l_tau - embedding delay for the source variable
        delay - time lag between last element of source and destination next value
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setProperty

        public void setProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName,
                        java.lang.String propertyValue)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets properties for the TE calculator. New property values are not guaranteed to take effect until the next call to an initialise method.

        Valid property names, and what their values should represent, include:

        • PROP_KRASKOV_ALG_NUM -- which Kraskov algorithm number to use (1 or 2).
        • Any properties accepted by TransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo.setProperty(String, String)
        • Or properties accepted by the underlying ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov.setProperty(String, String) implementation.

        Note: further properties may be defined by child classes.

        Unknown property values are ignored.

        Specified by:
        setProperty in interface InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Specified by:
        setProperty in interface TransferEntropyCalculator
        Overrides:
        setProperty in class TransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo
        Parameters:
        propertyName - name of the property
        propertyValue - value of the property.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is a problem with the supplied value).
